sub_title: Policy Advisor Diversity Management at Maastricht University
summary:
Over the years, I developed my main competences in organising large, high-level events and meetings, coordinating and monitoring advisory processes, setting up (new) projects and writing policy notes and reports. 

I thrive in a dynamic working environment and enjoy being the 'spill in the organization'. I am used to wearing different hats and swiftly switching between topics. I enjoy thinking along and/or shaping (new) projects and processes. I would describe my work method as careful, systemetic and pragmatic. My workethic, organizational talent, ingenuity and pragmatic attitude result in an efficient completion of my assigned tasks. 

I am known for my healthy dose of humor, with which I create a pleasant working environment, can quickly build contacts and that offers my colleagues a moment of relief in busy times. I am very team oriented and do not hesitate to jump in or think along if necessary.

projects.title: Student ambassador of the Netherlands, Project Connecting Cultures in Oman
projects.description: This project, created and led by Mark Evans, aimed to bring 12 young women from different nationalities together on a neutral platform (the Omani desert). His objective was to create a forum in which perceptions, differences and questions about other cultures could be openly discussed in order to identify, confront and remove the barriers of prejudice towards one another. The group's findings and experiences were presented at a final Ambassador's conference in Muscat.

projects.title: Co-founder & Board Member Student Team UNICEF Maastricht
projects.description: Together with 5 other students we built the foundation for the UNICEF student team in Maastricht in 2009, which is currently still active. The main aim here was to spread awareness of the student team, its purpose and the subjects UNICEF was dealing with in that particular year. Tasks included organizing two events a year (one for fundraising and one to create awareness on a particular subject UNICEF was giving special attention to that year) and recruiting volunteers

projects.title: Program Assistant Project "Stilstaan bij Vrijheid" / Freedom Train in Maastricht
projects.description: A project in light of the 65th anniversary of liberation in the Netherlands. A special train (train of freedom) designed for this event toured through the Netherlands and finally stopped in Maastricht. For this purpose, a one-day program was organized which included speakers/lecturers, themed discussion groups and an afternoon celebration.
